required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Twelve Month Clinical Evaluation of KeraSoft IC Soft Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Twelve Month Clinical Evaluation of KeraSoft IC Soft Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this twelve month dispensing study is to evaluate the clinical performance, particularly comfort and vision, of KeraSoft IC Soft Contact Lenses.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was terminated due to a business decision to cancel the entire project.

primary_outcome.description: Symptoms and complaints measured on an analog scale

secondary_outcome.description: Low contrast visual acuity measured with high ambient illumination (LCHI)
High contrast visual acuity measured with high ambient illumination (HCHI)

arm_group.description: KeraSoft IC Soft Contact Lenses, with CIBA Clear Care solution provided for lens care

intervention.description: Lenses will be worn between 8 and 16 hrs each day, for 12 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have participated and completed a previous study (ROC2-10-078).
- Is Keratoconic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has any systemic disease affecting ocular health.
- Is using any systemic or topical medications that will, in the Investigator's opinion, affect ocular physiology or lens performance.
- Is not correctable to 20/50 or better in each eye with contact lenses.
- Has greater than Grade 2 slit lamp exam findings.
- Has any atypical scar for a keratoconic or neovascularization within the central 4mm of the cornea. Subjects with minor peripheral corneal scarring that, in the Investigator's judgment, does not interfere with contact lens wear are eligible for this study.
- Has any neovascularization within the central 4mm of the cornea.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
